item.title: The dumbest things that happened in tech this year
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: From Sam Altman's olive oil "scandal" to Soham Parekh's viral moment, a lot of silly stuff has gone down in tech this year.

item.title: Almost 80 European deep tech university spinouts reached $1B valuations or $100M in revenue in 2025
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: According to Dealroom’s European Spinout Report 2025, 76 European deep tech and life sciences spinouts have either reached $1 billion valuations, $100 million in revenue, or both.

item.title: VCs predict enterprises will spend more on AI in 2026 — through fewer vendors
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Enterprises have been experimenting with AI tools for a few years. Investors predict they will start to pick winners in 2026.

item.title: The top 26 consumer/edtech companies from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort, Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Here is the full list of the consumer/edtech Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: How to make your startup stand out in a crowded market, according to investors
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: At TechCrunch Disrupt, three investors took the stage to dissect what makes — and breaks — a pitch deck. Jyoti Bansal, a founder-turned-investor; Medha Agarwal of Defy; and Jennifer Neundorfer of January Ventures shared with the crowd their candid views on what works in a pitch deck — and what doesn't.

item.description: Here is the full list of the enterprise tech Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: Sauron, the high-end home security startup for ‘super premium’ customers, plucks a new CEO out of Sonos
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Sauron is appearing on the scene as concerns rise about crime among the most wealthy.

item.title: MayimFlow wants to stop data center leaks before they happen
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Leaks cause damage and down time, and cost money. MayimFlow's founder John Khazraee wants to change that.

item.title: India startup funding hits $11B in 2025 as investors grow more selective
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Startup funding rounds in India fell sharply in 2025 as investors concentrated capital into fewer companies.

item.title: Investors share what to remember while raising a Series A
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The goalposts have moved, the stakes are higher, and investors seem pickier than ever as the AI boom reshapes the industry.

item.title: How reality crushed Ÿnsect, the French startup that had raised over $600M for insect farming
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: French insect farming company Ÿnsect was recently placed into judicial liquidation for insolvency, despite raising over $600 million.

item.title: Equity’s 2026 Predictions: AI Agents, Blockbuster IPOs, and the Future of VC
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Kirsten Korosec, Rebecca Bellan, Anthony Ha, Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: TechCrunch’s Equity crew is bringing 2025 to a close and getting ahead on the year to come with our annual predictions episode! Hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, and Rebecca Bellan were joined by Build Mode host Isabelle Johannessen to dissect the year’s biggest tech developments, from mega AI funding rounds that defied expectations to the rise of “physical AI,” and make […]

item.title: Naware’s chemical-free weed killer tech could change how we treat lawns
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: A classic hardware startup, Naware set out with a problem -- kill weeds without chemicals -- and relentlessly tinkered until they found a solution.

item.title: How a Spanish virus brought Google to Málaga
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Spanish entrepreneur Bernardo Quintero, whose company is at the root of Google's Málaga cybersecurity hub, identified the author of the computer virus that influenced his career.

item.title: The European startup market’s data doesn’t match its energy — yet
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Europe's startup market hasn't produced meaningful numbers but there is reason to believe the data will start to change.
